problem.script:
pepperoni = random.randint(8,12) veggie = pepperoni + random.randint(3,6)
pepCarbon = random.randint(8,12) / 10 pepCarbonDisp = "%0.1f" % pepCarbon vegCarbon = pepCarbon - random.randint(3,5)/10 vegCarbonDisp = "%0.1f" % vegCarbon
mitigationCost = (veggie - pepperoni)/(pepCarbon - vegCarbon) mitigationCostDisp = "%0.2f" % mitigationCost
problem.p: A pepperoni pizza costs $$pepperoni and causes $pepCarbonDisp tons of CO2 emissions. A super deluxe veggie pizza costs $$veggie and causes $vegCarbonDisp tons of CO2 emissions. Whatâ€™s the cost of mitigation for choosing the veggie pizza?
This problem has randomly generated costs that are different for each student.

formulaequationinput.label: What is the mitigation cost for a veggie pizza?
